concept_data.title: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

summary: The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD), a pivotal institution within the United Nations framework, plays a crucial role in global economic development and poverty alleviation. Established post-World War II, the IBRD provides financial and technical assistance to developing countries, facilitating sustainable development projects. In the context of EU legal and regulatory documents, the IBRD's activities align with the EU's external action objectives, particularly in promoting economic stability and governance in partner nations. The EU collaborates with the IBRD to enhance financial mechanisms, ensuring compliance with international standards and fostering economic resilience in vulnerable regions.
